tit.e: Juni Shinsho, the twelve protective deities
tit.cmt: 十二神将（じゅうにしんしょう）http://www.aisf.or.jp/%7Ejaanus/

sen.j: 十二神将（じゅうにしんしょう）は、仏教の信仰・造像の対象である天部の神々で、また護法善神である。
sen.e: Juni Shinsho, the twelve protective deities, are Tembu, Deities who reside in a heavenly realm, one of six realms in which the souls of living beings transmigrate from one to another, which are worshipped and shaped into statues in Buddhism, and good deities to guard Buddhism as well.

Juni Shinsho (the 12 protective deities) are tembu, deities who reside in a heavenly realm, one of six realms in which the souls of living beings transmigrate from one to another; they are worshiped and shaped into statues in Buddhism, and are good deities that guard Buddhism.

Juni Shinsho (the 12 protective deities) are tenbu, deities who reside in a heavenly realm, one of six realms in which the souls of living beings transmigrate from one to another; they are worshiped and shaped into statues in Buddhism, and are good deities that guard Buddhism.

sen.j: 十二夜叉大将、十二神明王（じゅうに・やしゃたいしょう、しんみょうおう）ともいい、薬師如来および薬師経を信仰する者を守護するとされる12の武神である。
sen.e: It is also called Juni Yashataisho or Juni Shinmyoo and consists from twelve war gods who guard people who believe Yakushi-nyorai and Yakushi-kyo Sutra.
They are also called Juni Yashataisho or Juni Shinmyoo and comprise 12 war gods who guard people who believe in the Yakushi-nyorai and Yakushi-kyo sutra.
They are also called Juni Yashataisho or Juni Shinmyoo and comprise 12 war gods who guard people who believe in the Yakushi-nyorai and Yakushi-kyo sutra.

sen.j: 十二神将は、薬師如来の12の大願に応じて、昼夜の12時を保護するという。
sen.e: It is said that Juni Shinsho guard each twelve hours of day and night in accordance with the twelve wishes of Yakushi-nyorai.
It is said that the Juni Shinsho guard each 12 hours of the day and night in accordance with the 12 wishes of Yakushi-nyorai.
It is said that the Juni Shinsho guard each 12 hours of the day and night in accordance with the 12 wishes of Yakushi-nyorai.

sen.j: そのため十二支が配当される。
sen.e: For this reason, zodiac is applied.
For this reason the zodiac is applied.
For this reason the zodiac is applied.

sen.j: 各神将がそれぞれ7千、総計8万4千の眷属夜叉を率いるという。
sen.e: Each protective deity heads each 7,000 attendants, covering a total of 84,000 of Yasha, i.e., a class of semidivine being usually considered to be of a benevolent and inoffensive disposition but sometimes also classed with malignant spirits.

Each protective deity heads each of 7,000 attendants, covering a total of 84,000 yasha, i.e., a class of semi-divine being usually considered to be of a benevolent and inoffensive disposition but sometimes also classified with malignant spirits.

Each protective deity heads each of 7,000 attendants, covering a total of 84,000 Yasha, i.e., a class of semi-divine being usually considered to be of a benevolent and inoffensive disposition but sometimes also classified together with malignant spirits.
sen.cmt: 夜叉を大文字にしました。

sen.j: 頭上には各十二支の動物を形どった標識を置くことが多い。
sen.e: Above their heads they often put signs which are modeled from animals of zodiac.
Above their heads are often placed signs modeled after the animals of the zodiac.
Above their heads are often placed signs modeled after the animals of the zodiac.

sen.j: 日本では奈良・新薬師寺の等身大の十二神将像が、最古の作であるとともに造形的にも優れたものとして名高い。
sen.e: In Japan the life-size statue of Juni Shinsho at Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple in Nara is the oldest and famous for an excellent shape.
In Japan the life-size statue of Juni Shinsho at Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple in Nara is the oldest, and it is famous for its excellence of form.
In Japan the life-size statue of Juni Shinsho at Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple in Nara is the oldest, and it is famous for its excellence of form.

sen.j: また、十二神将にはそれぞれ本地の仏・菩薩・明王などがある。
sen.e: In addition Juni Shinsho have each principal image of Buddha such as Buddha, Bosatsu and Myoo.
sen.cmt: 本地 Webster's Online Dictionary、仏 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: Additionally, the Juni Shinsho have each principal image of Buddha such as Buddha, Bosatsu and Myoo.
Additionally, the Juni Shinsho have each principal image of Buddha such as Buddha, Bosatsu and Myoo.

sen.j: それぞれの名称と対応する本地尊と十二支は次のとおりである（経典によって若干用字や読みが異なるが、ここではもっとも一般的なものを挙げる）。
sen.e: Each name and its corresponding principal image of Buddha and zodiac is following (although there are a few differences in letters and sounds depending on sutras, following names are used popularly).

Each name and its corresponding principal image of Buddha and the zodiac follows (although there are a few differences in the letters and sounds, depending on the sutras, but the following names are commonly used).

Each name and its corresponding principal image of Buddha and the zodiac follows (although there are a few differences in the letters and sounds, depending on the sutras, but the following names are commonly used).

sen.j: 上記12体の持物、ポーズ等は必ずしも統一されたものでなく、図像的特色のみから各像を区別することはほとんど不可能である。
sen.e: Above twelve deities's belongings and poses are not necessarily unified and it is almost impossible to distinguish them only by characters of pictures and statues.
Although the 12 deities' belongings and poses are not necessarily unified, it is nearly impossible to distinguish them only by characters depicted in pictures and statues.
Although the 12 deities' belongings and poses are not necessarily unified, it is nearly impossible to distinguish them only by characters depicted in pictures and statues.

sen.j: 十二神将像は、中国では早くから制作され、敦煌市壁画にも作例がある。
sen.e: In China the statue of Juni Shinsho had been produced in the early times and there is an example of wall painting in Dunhuang City.
In China the statue of Juni Shinsho had been produced in early times, and there is an example of wall painting in Dunhuang City.
In China the statue of Juni Shinsho had been produced in early times, and there is an example of wall painting in Dunhuang City.

sen.j: 中国では十二支と結び付けて信仰され、日本における作例にも頭上に十二支の動物を戴くものが多い。
sen.e: In China they have been worshipped tied with zodiac and many works in Japan also put animals of zodiac above the heads.
In China they have been worshiped in association with the zodiac, and many works in Japan also depict animals of the zodiac above their heads.
In China they have been worshiped in association with the zodiac, and many works in Japan also depict animals of the zodiac above their heads.

sen.j: 日本では奈良時代（8世紀）の奈良・新薬師寺像をはじめ、数多く制作されている。
sen.e: In Japan many statues such as the statue of Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple in Nara (8th centuries) in Nara Period have been produced.
In Japan many statues such as the statue of Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple in Nara (eighth century) in the Nara period have been produced.
In Japan many statues such as the statue of Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple in Nara (eighth century) in the Nara period have been produced.

sen.j: 多くの場合、薬師如来を本尊とする仏堂において、薬師如来の左右に6体ずつ、あるいは仏壇の前方に横一列に安置される。
sen.e: In many cases, at the Buddhism halls where Yakushi-nyorai is placed as the principle image of Buddha, each six deity is placed on the left and right side of Yakushi-nyorai, or in a line ahead of Buddhist altar.
sen.cmt: 本尊 Webster's Online Dictionary、光背 Webster's Online Dictionary
sen.e: In many cases, at the Buddhist halls where Yakushi-nyorai is placed as the principle image of Buddha, each of six deities is placed on the left and right side of Yakushi-nyorai, or in a line ahead of the Buddhist altar.

In many cases, at the Buddhist halls where Yakushi-nyorai is placed as the principle image of Buddha, each of six deities is placed on the left and right side of Yakushi-nyorai, or in a line ahead of the Buddhist altar.

sen.j: 新薬師寺像のように円形の仏壇周囲をぐるりと取り囲んで配置される場合もあり、薬師如来像の光背や台座部分に十二神将を表す場合もあるなど、表現形態はさまざまである。
sen.e: There are various way of expression; in one case they are placed around circular Buddhist altar such as the statues of Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple, and in the other case they are shaped on halo or foundation of the statue of Yakushi-nyorai.

There are various ways of expression; in one case they are placed around a circular Buddhist altar such as the statues of Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple, and in another case they form a halo or a foundation of the statue of Yakushi-nyorai.

There are various ways of expression; in one case they are placed around a circular Buddhist altar such as the statues of Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple, and in another case they form a halo or a foundation of the statue of Yakushi-nyorai.

sen.j: 四天王像などと同様、甲冑を着けた武神の姿で表され、12体それぞれの個性を表情、ポーズなどで彫り分け、群像として変化をつけた作例が多い。
sen.e: They are shown as war gods as same as the statue of Shitenno, Four Guardian Kings, and in many works each twelve characters are distinguished by facial expressions or poses and vary widely as a group.

They are shown as war gods, the same as the statues of the Shitenno (four guardian kings), and in many works each of twelve characters is distinguished by its facial expression or pose, and they vary widely as a group.

They are shown as war gods, the same as the statues of the Shitenno (four guardian kings), and in many works each of twelve characters is distinguished by its facial expression or pose, and they vary widely as a group.

tit.j: 陰陽道における十二天将
tit.e: Juni Tensho in Onmyo-do, way of yin and Yang
Juni Tensho in Onmyo-do, the way of yin and yang
Juni Tensho in Onmyo-do, the way of yin and yang

sen.j: また上記の仏典とは異なり、陰陽道の占術・式占の一つである六壬神課で使用する十二天将も、間違って十二神将と呼ばれることがある。
sen.e: In addition, different from above Buddhist scriptures, Juni Tensho, which is used in Rikujinshinka, one of the mantic or Shikisen in Onmyo-do, is sometimes called Juni Shinsyo wrongly.
sen.cmt: 仏典 Webster Online Dictionary、式占 http://www.ricoh.co.jp/net-messena/ACADEMIA/SHUTSUDO/reikai/2002reikai.htm、六壬神課 http://www.nifty.com/ougi/rikujin/
sen.e: Additionally, as opposed to the above Buddhist scriptures, Juni Tensho, which is used in Rikujinshinka, one of the mantic or shikisen in Onmyo-do, is sometimes incorrectly called Juni Shinsyo.
Additionally, as opposed to the above Buddhist scriptures, Juni Tensho, which is used in Rikujinshinka, one of the mantic or shikisen in Onmyo-do, is sometimes incorrectly called Juni Shinsyo.

sen.j: 陰陽師として名高い安倍晴明が残した占事略决の第4章の「十二将所主法第四」では十二天将が表す事柄について以下のように解説されている。
sen.e: In 'Junisho Shoshuhodaiyon', the fourth chapter of Senjiryakketsu, which ABE no Seimei, a famous master of Onmyo-do, wrote, things which Juni Tensyo reveal are explained as below.
